newsitem.title: USA: Ziff-Davis names Sheer as president of U.S. unit.
newsitem.headline: Ziff-Davis names Sheer as president of U.S. unit.

text.p: Ziff-Davis said Wednesday it named Claude Sheer, a 17-year company veteran, to be president of its U.S. publications unit.
Sheer replaces Ronni Sonnenberg, who will retire at the end of the year.

According to industry estimates, Ziff-Davis publications in the U.S. recorded total revenues of about $1.15 billion in 1996. While the company does not report results in the U.S., a Ziff-Davis spokesman called the estimate reasonable.
According to one industry estimate, ad revenues in the U.S. are up 12.9 percent year-to-date through May.
Ziff-Davis publishes about 20 computer magazines, including PC Magazine, Computer Shopper and PC Week as well as MacUser and MacWeek.
Sonnenberg, a 20-year veteran of Ziff-Davis, has been president of the U.S. unit since March 1996.
Ziff-Davis, a unit of Softbank Corp, also said Jeffrey Ballowe, president of the company's interactive media and development group, will retire at the end of the year.
